svg.style: background: #ffffff; background-color: light-dark(#ffffff, var(--ge-dark-color, #121212)); color-scheme: light dark;
svg.content:
<mxfile host="app.diagrams.net" agent="Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/133.0.0.0 Safari/537.36" version="26.0.16" pages="2" scale="1" border="0"> <diagram name="Page-1" id="y1VPcpp46RtRkmRhEWHq"> <mxGraphModel dx="2750" dy="1665" grid="1" gridSize="10" guides="1" tooltips="1" connect="1" arrows="1" fold="1" page="1" pageScale="1" pageWidth="850" pageHeight="1100" math="0" shadow="0"> <root> <mxCell id="0" /> <mxCell id="1" parent="0" /> <UserObject label="<strong data-start="318" data-end="344">E-Commerce Web Crawler</strong><br data-start="344" data-end="347"><em data-start="347" data-end="402">Automating product discovery across multiple websites</em><br data-start="402" data-end="405"><strong data-start="408" data-end="425">Technologies:</strong> Golang, Chromedp, PostgreSQL, Redis, Docker, Railway.app" link="<strong data-start="318" data-end="344">E-Commerce Web Crawler</strong><br data-start="344" data-end="347"><em data-start="347" data-end="402">Automating product discovery across multiple websites</em><br data-start="402" data-end="405">������ <strong data-start="408" data-end="425">Technologies:</strong> Golang, Chromedp, PostgreSQL, Redis, Docker, Railway.app" id="Uu0GhZpgVCWZH_Pq3_DW-1"> <mxCell style="text;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="-750" y="-100" width="460" height="70" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> </UserObject> <UserObject label="<p data-start="580" data-end="898"><strong data-start="601" data-end="614">Objective</strong> → Build a web crawler to extract <strong data-start="648" data-end="664">product URLs</strong> from multiple e-commerce websites.</p><p data-start="580" data-end="898">&nbsp;<strong data-start="705" data-end="721">Key Features</strong> → Handles <strong data-start="732" data-end="754">infinite scrolling</strong>, supports <strong data-start="765" data-end="785">multiple domains</strong>, stores results in <strong data-start="805" data-end="819">PostgreSQL</strong>.</p><p data-start="580" data-end="898">&nbsp;<strong data-start="826" data-end="840">Deployment</strong> → Runs <strong data-start="848" data-end="872">locally using Docker</strong> and <strong data-start="877" data-end="895">on Railway.app</strong>.</p><p data-start="900" data-end="1082"><strong data-start="1144" data-end="1185">What problem does this project solve?</strong><br data-start="1185" data-end="1188">Manually finding product URLs across&nbsp;<strong data-start="1227" data-end="1257">different e-commerce sites</strong>&nbsp;is time-consuming.<br data-start="1276" data-end="1279">Many sites use&nbsp;<strong data-start="1296" data-end="1315">dynamic loading</strong>&nbsp;or&nbsp;<strong data-start="1319" data-end="1347">different URL structures</strong>.<br data-start="1348" data-end="1351">We need an&nbsp;<strong data-start="1364" data-end="1386">automated solution</strong>&nbsp;that can handle various cases efficiently.</p><p data-start="900" data-end="1082"><br></p><p data-start="900" data-end="1082"><br></p><p data-start="900" data-end="1082"><strong data-start="1436" data-end="1463">Our Web Crawler Should:</strong><br data-start="1463" data-end="1466">&nbsp;Automatically discover product URLs&nbsp;&nbsp;Support multiple e-commerce platforms&nbsp;&nbsp;Handle&nbsp;<strong data-start="1557" data-end="1592">infinite scrolling &amp; pagination&nbsp;</strong>&nbsp;Avoid&nbsp;<strong data-start="1603" data-end="1621">duplicate URLs</strong>&nbsp;using&nbsp;<strong data-start="1628" data-end="1637">Redis&nbsp;</strong>&nbsp;Store results in&nbsp;<strong data-start="1659" data-end="1673">PostgreSQL</strong></p><p data-start="900" data-end="1082"><br data-start="928" data-end="931"><br data-start="1047" data-end="1050"><br></p>" link="<p data-start="580" data-end="898"><strong data-start="601" data-end="614">Objective</strong> → Build a web crawler to extract <strong data-start="648" data-end="664">product URLs</strong> from multiple e-commerce websites.<br data-start="699" data-end="702">������ <strong data-start="705" data-end="721">Key Features</strong> → Handles <strong data-start="732" data-end="754">infinite scrolling</strong>, supports <strong data-start="765" data-end="785">multiple domains</strong>, stores results in <strong data-start="805" data-end="819">PostgreSQL</strong>.<br data-start="820" data-end="823">������ <strong data-start="826" data-end="840">Deployment</strong> → Runs <strong data-start="848" data-end="872">locally using Docker</strong> and <strong data-start="877" data-end="895">on Railway.app</strong>.</p><p data-start="900" data-end="1082">������ <strong data-start="903" data-end="928">Goal of this session:</strong><br data-start="928" data-end="931">✅ Understand project requirements<br data-start="964" data-end="967">✅ Explore the <strong data-start="981" data-end="999">code structure</strong><br data-start="999" data-end="1002">✅ Learn how to <strong data-start="1017" data-end="1047">run the crawler in VS Code</strong><br data-start="1047" data-end="1050">✅ Deploy it on <strong data-start="1065" data-end="1080">Railway.app</strong></p>" id="Uu0GhZpgVCWZH_Pq3_DW-3"> <mxCell style="text;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="-785" y="-10" width="560" height="190" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> </UserObject> <mxCell id="Uu0GhZpgVCWZH_Pq3_DW-4" value="
<span style="color: rgb(255, 255, 255); font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(27, 29, 30); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial; display: inline !important; float: none;">Understand project requirements</span><br style="forced-color-adjust: none; box-shadow: none !important; color: rgb(255, 255, 255); font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(27, 29, 30); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial; display: inline !important; float: none;">Explore the<span>&nbsp;</span></span><strong style="forced-color-adjust: none; box-shadow: none !important; color: rgb(255, 255, 255); font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(27, 29, 30); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;" data-start="981" data-end="999">code structure</strong><br style="forced-color-adjust: none; box-shadow: none !important; color: rgb(255, 255, 255); font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(27, 29, 30); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;" data-start="999" data-end="1002"><span style="color: rgb(255, 255, 255); font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(27, 29, 30); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial; display: inline !important; float: none;">check how to<span>&nbsp;</span></span><strong style="forced-color-adjust: none; box-shadow: none !important; color: rgb(255, 255, 255); font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(27, 29, 30); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial;" data-start="1017" data-end="1047">run the crawler in VS Code</strong>

" style="text;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="-630" y="290" width="250" height="70" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="Uu0GhZpgVCWZH_Pq3_DW-5" value="<p data-end="1753" data-start="1709"><strong data-end="1751" data-start="1730">Technologies Used</strong></p><p data-end="1753" data-start="1709"><strong style="background-color: transparent; color: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(255, 255, 255));" data-end="1766" data-start="1756">Golang</strong><span style="background-color: transparent; color: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(255, 255, 255));"> → For backend logic &amp; concurrency\</span></p><p data-end="1753" data-start="1709"><strong style="background-color: transparent; color: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(255, 255, 255));" data-end="1817" data-start="1805">Chromedp</strong><span style="background-color: transparent; color: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(255, 255, 255));"> → For </span><strong style="background-color: transparent; color: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(255, 255, 255));" data-end="1849" data-start="1824">headless web scraping</strong></p><p data-end="1753" data-start="1709"><strong style="background-color: transparent; color: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(255, 255, 255));" data-end="1868" data-start="1854">PostgreSQL</strong><span style="background-color: transparent; color: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(255, 255, 255));"> → For storing product URLs&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></p><p data-end="1753" data-start="1709"><strong style="background-color: transparent; color: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(255, 255, 255));" data-end="1909" data-start="1900">Redis</strong><span style="background-color: transparent; color: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(255, 255, 255));"> → For caching visited URLs</span></p><p data-end="1753" data-start="1709"><strong style="background-color: transparent; color: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(255, 255, 255));" data-end="1951" data-start="1941">Docker</strong><span style="background-color: transparent; color: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(255, 255, 255));"> → For containerized setup</span></p><p data-end="1753" data-start="1709"><strong style="background-color: transparent; color: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(255, 255, 255));" data-end="1997" data-start="1982">Railway.app</strong><span style="background-color: transparent; color: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(255, 255, 255));"> → For cloud deployment</span></p><p data-end="1753" data-start="1709"><strong style="background-color: transparent; color: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(255, 255, 255));" data-end="2042" data-start="2027"><br></strong></p><p data-end="1753" data-start="1709"><strong style="background-color: transparent; color: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(255, 255, 255));" data-end="2042" data-start="2027"><br></strong></p><p data-end="1753" data-start="1709"><strong style="background-color: transparent; color: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(255, 255, 255));" data-end="2042" data-start="2027">Why Golang?</strong></p><p data-end="2122" data-start="2024">✔ Fast execution<br data-end="2064" data-start="2061">✔ Built-in concurrency<br data-end="2089" data-start="2086">✔ Good for backend web scraping</p>" style="text;html=1;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;resizable=0;points=[];autosize=1;strokeColor=none;fillColor=none;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="-790" y="410" width="260" height="340" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="Uu0GhZpgVCWZH_Pq3_DW-7" value="<p data-start="2185" data-end="2426"><strong data-start="2185" data-end="2199">Input:</strong> List of e-commerce domains&nbsp;</p><p data-start="2185" data-end="2426"><strong style="background-color: transparent; color: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(255, 255, 255));" data-start="2232" data-end="2248">Crawler:</strong></p><p data-start="2185" data-end="2426">Loads website dynamically</p><p data-start="2185" data-end="2426"><span style="background-color: transparent; color: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(255, 255, 255));">Handles infinite scrolling&nbsp;</span></p><p data-start="2185" data-end="2426">Extracts product URLs</p><p data-start="2185" data-end="2426">Stores results in PostgreSQL</p><p data-start="2185" data-end="2426"><strong style="background-color: transparent; color: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(255, 255, 255));" data-start="2383" data-end="2398">Output:</strong><span style="background-color: transparent; color: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(255, 255, 255));"> JSON file + DB Storage</span><br data-start="2380" data-end="2383"></p><p data-start="2428" data-end="2518"><strong data-start="2431" data-end="2448"><br></strong></p><p data-start="2428" data-end="2518"><strong data-start="2431" data-end="2448">How it Works:</strong><br data-start="2448" data-end="2451">Scraper loads page → Extracts product URLs → Stores them in DB</p>" style="text;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="-425" y="370" width="410" height="280" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="Uu0GhZpgVCWZH_Pq3_DW-11" value="" style="edgeStyle=orthogonalEdgeStyle;rounded=0;orthogonalLoop=1;jettySize=auto;html=1;" parent="1" source="Uu0GhZpgVCWZH_Pq3_DW-9" target="Uu0GhZpgVCWZH_Pq3_DW-10" edge="1"> <mxGeometry relative="1" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="Uu0GhZpgVCWZH_Pq3_DW-13" value="" style="edgeStyle=orthogonalEdgeStyle;rounded=0;orthogonalLoop=1;jettySize=auto;html=1;" parent="1" <mxPoint x="-730" y="1780" /> <mxPoint x="-730" y="1790" /> <mxPoint x="-760" y="1790" /> </Array> </mxGeometry> </mxCell> <mxCell id="Uu0GhZpgVCWZH_Pq3_DW-28" value="store unique URLs in DB, JSON file&nbsp;" style="rounded=1;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="-718" y="1750" width="540" height="60" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="Uu0GhZpgVCWZH_Pq3_DW-33" value=" For Each Website, Launch Chrome&nbsp;Navigate to URL &amp; Handle Lazy-Loading (JS) ,&nbsp;Perform Infinite Scroll to Load More Content" style="text;html=1;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;resizable=0;points=[];autosize=1;strokeColor=none;fillColor=none;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="-840" y="1230" width="700" height="30" id="Uu0GhZpgVCWZH_Pq3_DW-36" value="" style="curved=1;endArrow=classic;html=1;rounded=0;" parent="1" target="Uu0GhZpgVCWZH_Pq3_DW-14" edge="1"> <mxGeometry width="50" height="50" relative="1" as="geometry"> <mxPoint x="-520" y="1230" as="sourcePoint" /> <mxPoint x="-470" y="1180" as="targetPoint" /> <Array as="points"> <mxPoint x="-470" y="1230" /> <mxPoint x="-520" y="1180" /> </Array> </mxGeometry> </mxCell> <mxCell id="Uu0GhZpgVCWZH_Pq3_DW-14" value="Load domains from input file and start concurrent crawling" style="whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;rounded=0;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="-530" y="1170" width="120" height="60" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="Uu0GhZpgVCWZH_Pq3_DW-37" value="" style="endArrow=classic;html=1;rounded=0;entryX=0;entryY=0;entryDx=0;entryDy=0;" parent="1" target="Uu0GhZpgVCWZH_Pq3_DW-14" edge="1"> <mxGeometry width="50" height="50" relative="1" as="geometry"> <mxPoint x="-760" y="1150" as="sourcePoint" /> <mxPoint x="-670" y="1120" as="targetPoint" /> <Array as="points"> <mxPoint x="-560" y="1150" /> </Array> </mxGeometry> </mxCell> <mxCell id="Uu0GhZpgVCWZH_Pq3_DW-38" value="continue crawling until no page or product found" style="text;html=1;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;resizable=0;points=[];autosize=1;strokeColor=none;fillColor=none;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="-890" y="1718" width="280" height="30" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> </root> </mxGraphModel> </diagram> <diagram id="s5KMS7EqOrz541uuM70r" name="Page-2"> <mxGraphModel dx="1050" dy="565" grid="1" gridSize="10" guides="1" tooltips="1" connect="1" arrows="1" fold="1" page="1" pageScale="1" pageWidth="850" pageHeight="1100" math="0" shadow="0"> <root> <mxCell id="0" /> <mxCell id="1" parent="0" /> <mxCell id="TK2ooU5oeG7MPGdLHk4h-1" value="<p data-start="345" data-end="513">Hey everyone, welcome to this video! Today, we’ll be building a <strong data-start="434" data-end="455">web crawler in Go</strong> that extracts product URLs from e-commerce websites. ������</p><p data-start="515" data-end="731">We'll be covering:<br data-start="533" data-end="536">✅ Crawling web pages using <strong data-start="563" data-end="572">Colly</strong><br data-start="572" data-end="575">✅ Handling <strong data-start="586" data-end="617">JavaScript-rendered content</strong> with <strong data-start="623" data-end="635">ChromeDP</strong><br data-start="635" data-end="638">✅ Storing visited URLs in <strong data-start="664" data-end="673">Redis</strong> for deduplication<br data-start="691" data-end="694">✅ Saving results as a <strong data-start="716" data-end="729">JSON file</strong></p><p data-start="733" data-end="871">At the end of this video, you'll have a fully functional <strong data-start="790" data-end="805">web crawler</strong> that can extract and save e-commerce product URLs efficiently!</p>" style="text;whiteSpace=wrap;html=1;" vertex="1" parent="1"> <mxGeometry x="160" y="80" width="560" height="300" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> </root> </mxGraphModel> </diagram> </mxfile>

a.xlink:href:
https://app.diagrams.net/E-Commerce Web Crawler
Automating product discovery across multiple websites
������ Technologies: Golang, Chromedp, PostgreSQL, Redis, Docker, Railway.app

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 458px; height: 1px; padding-top: 7px; margin-left: 142px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left; color: #000000;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: "Helvetica"; color: light-dark(#000000, #ffffff); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div:
E-Commerce Web Crawler
Automating product discovery across multiple websites
Technologies: Golang, Chromedp, PostgreSQL, Redis, Docker, Railway.app

a.xlink:href:
https://app.diagrams.net/

Objective → Build a web crawler to extract product URLs from multiple e-commerce websites.
������ Key Features → Handles infinite scrolling, supports multiple domains, stores results in PostgreSQL.
������ Deployment → Runs locally using Docker and on Railway.app.

������ Goal of this session:
✅ Understand project requirements
✅ Explore the code structure
✅ Learn how to run the crawler in VS Code
✅ Deploy it on Railway.app

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 558px; height: 1px; padding-top: 97px; margin-left: 107px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left; color: #000000;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: "Helvetica"; color: light-dark(#000000, #ffffff); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.p: Objective → Build a web crawler to extract product URLs from multiple e-commerce websites.
Key Features → Handles infinite scrolling, supports multiple domains, stores results in PostgreSQL.
Deployment → Runs locally using Docker and on Railway.app.

What problem does this project solve?
Manually finding product URLs across different e-commerce sites is time-consuming.
Many sites use dynamic loading or different URL structures.
We need an automated solution that can handle various cases efficiently.

Our Web Crawler Should:
Automatically discover product URLs Support multiple e-commerce platforms Handle infinite scrolling & pagination Avoid duplicate URLs using Redis Store results in PostgreSQL

switch.text: Objective → Build a web crawler to extract product URLs from multiple e-commerce websites....

✔ Fast execution
✔ Built-in concurrency
✔ Good for backend web scraping

How it Works:
Scraper loads page → Extracts product URLs → Stores them in DB
